hanzi-su-wiki:
収

Значения

Помещать, убирать; получать, приобретать; вносить (плату и т.д.)

Мнемоника

Руками 又 обрывать вьющийся вокруг столба хмель (слева). Собирать урожай, получать от него доход.

Варианты

收
purpleculture_pinyin:
shōu
variant of 收
вариант получения
rtega_mnemonic:
収収RS㧃收gather together, collect, harvest, income
  • connect 丩 hands 又/攵: people gathering together; hand 又/攵 holding a receptacle 丩 to collect the income
Keyword_KANJIDIC: income, obtain, reap, pay, supply, store
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: доход, получить, жнут, оплата, поставка, хранение
koohiiStory1: Prostitutes can make a veritable cornucopia of income by using their crotches -- they put the "come" in "income." (A bit lewd perhaps, but effective in keeping this character distinct from similar keywords like profit (#906) or earnings (#893)).
koohiiStory2: Women love men with money. If you have a high income you can get a cornicopia of crotches.
jp_example_words:
収まる(おさまる): to be obtained, to end, to settle into, to fit into, to be settled, to be paid, to be delivered
収める(おさめる): to obtain, to reap, to pay, to supply, to accept
回収(かいしゅう): collection, recovery
収益(しゅうえき): earnings, proceeds, returns
収支(しゅうし): income and expenditure
収集(しゅうしゅう): gathering up, collection, accumulation
収容(しゅうよう): accommodation, reception, seating, housing, custody, admission, entering (in a dictionary)
徴収(ちょうしゅう): collection, levy
没収(ぼっしゅう): forfeited
吸収(きゅうしゅう): absorption, suction, attraction
収穫(しゅうかく): harvest, crop, ingathering
収入(しゅうにゅう): income, receipts, revenue
領収(りょうしゅう): receipt, voucher
jp_readingExamples: 収まる (おさ.まる), 収める (おさ.める)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Wrap vines around a stool to obtain it. Don't worry about paying for it, sneak into the stool store and tie some vines around the legs. Then when you leave, pull the vines and the stool will come out after. That's how you obtain a stool!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You can obtain a lot of goods this way without needing any cash. Just don't tell anyone I told you.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Today you want to obtain a new pair of shoes (しゅう). You tie your vines around the stool they're on, and slowly inch them toward the door.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You have to pull very slowly, or the shoes will fall off the stool. But you really, really want to obtain these particular shoes (they're really sweet), so you keep scooting them toward you.
Ru_Meaning: income, obtain, reap, pay, supply, store
Ru_Words:
収めるおさめる
  • получать, приобретать
  • вносить, уплачивать
  • убирать, помещать куда-л
  • поставлять (напр. продукты), приносить в дар (в храм)
  • собирать
    • warodai
    収まるおさまる
  • быть внесённым (уплаченным)
  • быть помещённым, поместиться куда-л
  • быть равнодушным, быть спокойным (хладнокровным)
  • быть довольным, быть удовлетворённым
    • warodai
  • быть мирным, быть спокойным, утихать, стихать (о пожаре, боли и т. п.)
  • разрешаться, улаживаться (напр. о ссоре)
    • warodai
    収入しゅうにゅう
  • доход, приход, поступления
    • 収支しゅうし
  • приход и расход
    • 収益しゅうえき
  • прибыль, доход
    • 収集しゅうしゅう
  • сбор
    • 買収ばいしゅう
  • покупка, закупка
Kanshudo_mnemonic: connect (丩) again (又) to supply

Heisig constituents: income, cornucopia, crotch
Heisig: Cornucopia . . . crotch. Keep distinct from both fare (Frame 1079) and salary (Frame 1449).
koohii1: Prostitutes can make a veritable cornucopia of income by using their crotches -- they put the "come" in "income." (A bit lewd perhaps, but effective in keeping this character distinct from similar keywords like profit (#906) or earnings (#893)).
koohii2: Women love men with money. If you have a high income you can get a cornicopia of crotches.

収字的基本解释

収
shōu
同“收”。

収字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shōu］
［《廣韻》式州切，平尤，書。］
［《廣韻》舒救切，去宥，書。］
亦作“収1”。亦作“敊2”。
(1)拘捕。
(2)指执行拘捕任务的人。
(3)收取；接纳。
(4)收回。
(5)收获。
(6)指收获的农作物。
(7)没收。
(8)收购。
(9)聚集；收集。
(10)攻取；占据。
(11)约束；控制。
(12)指收缩。
(13)收拢。
(14)殓葬。
(15)消散，消失。
(16)结束；停止。
(17)撤回。
(18)凋萎。
(19)夏代称冠。
(20)车箱前后两端的横木。
(21)建除十二辰之一。
(22)通“糾”。纠合，联合。

収字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【又字部】　収； 康熙笔画：4； 页码：页165第21
【廣韻】收俗作収。

収字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
収字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Receive
shōu
Same as "receive".
Receive
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [shōu]
["Guangyun" style state cut, Pingyou, book. ]
["Guang Yun" Shu Jiuqie, go to You, book. ]
Also called "Receive 1". Also known as "敊2".
(1) Arrest.
(2) Refers to the person performing the task of arrest.
(3) Receive; Accept.
(4) Take it back.
(5) Harvest.
(6) Refers to harvested crops.
(7) Confiscation.
(8) Acquisition.
(9) Gather; collect.
(10) Attack; occupy.
(11) Constraint; control.
(12) Refers to contraction.
(13) Close up.
(14) Funeral.
(15) Dissipate and disappear.
(16) End; stop.
(17) Withdrawn.
(18) Withering.
(19) The Xia Dynasty was crowned.
(20) The beams at the front and rear ends of the carriage.
(21) Build one of the twelve days apart.
(22) Through "correction". Entanglement, union.

Name meaning
Nothing.
shōu
яп. вм. 收
Radicals: 丩, 又  (vines, stool)
Meaning Mnemonic
Wrap vines around a stool to obtain it. Don't worry about paying for it, sneak into the stool store and tie some vines around the legs. Then when you leave, pull the vines and the stool will come out after. That's how you obtain a stool!
You can obtain a lot of goods this way without needing any cash. Just don't tell anyone I told you.
Reading Mnemonic
Today you want to obtain a new pair of shoes (しゅう). You tie your vines around the stool they're on, and slowly inch them toward the door.
You have to pull very slowly, or the shoes will fall off the stool. But you really, really want to obtain these particular shoes (they're really sweet), so you keep scooting them toward you.
